body_html:
Hi @girving , when I run this code, the result shows that it just need 0.0273 second in the first epoch while 0.1528 second in the 200th epoch, and I don't know what is wrong with my code

import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np
import time

delta = np.random.uniform(size=(500, 500))
weight = tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal([500, 500]))

x = tf.placeholder('float')
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables())

for epoch in range(200):
    t = time.time()
    for batch in range(10):
        update = weight.assign_add(x)
        sess.run(update, feed_dict={x: delta})
    print 'epoch %s done, time used %s' % (epoch, time.time()-t)

Sorry for my bad english :D

body:
Hi @girving , when I run this code, the result shows that it just need 0.0273 second in the first epoch while 0.1528 second in the 200th epoch, and I don't know what is wrong with my code

```
import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np
import time

delta = np.random.uniform(size=(500, 500))
weight = tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal([500, 500]))

x = tf.placeholder('float')
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables())

for epoch in range(200):
    t = time.time()
    for batch in range(10):
        update = weight.assign_add(x)
        sess.run(update, feed_dict={x: delta})
    print 'epoch %s done, time used %s' % (epoch, time.time()-t)
```

Sorry for my bad english :D
